title: New Install is slower than expected...what am I doing wrong?
content:
I was looking for a new client that would allow for a truly unified inbox and installed Thunderbird (win 11). I used TB in the past and liked it.

However, it seems very slow and is in the process of downloading message 1952 of 45806 in Inbox. At this rate it's going to take a couple of weeks to be complete.

I have two accounts (1 gmail, one Exchange) and have installed Owl. I think I asked it to download the last 60 days worth of messages. What settings should I change to make it faster? I also think there are messages that are not appearing as the client on my phone seems to have some additional (recent) messages that don't appear in TB.

Thanks in advance for any advice!
creator: carlson800

title: Thunderbird buttons are only working once
content: For the past few weeks, I've been having a problem with Thunderbird's buttons. When I have an email open, I can usually click the "delete" or "junk" button to send it where it needs to go, and the next email will automatically appear. But recently, those buttons only work once: if I click "delete" or "junk" on the second email that comes up, nothing happens. I have to close that email and delete or junk it from the Inbox. Am I the only person having this problem? I tried deleting the Trash files in the profile, but that didn't help.
creator: storm7

title: The latest version of thunderbird has changed and erased some of my folders.
content:
The latest version of thunderbird 115.3.0 (54-bit) has rearranged my folders, and the junkmail folders for all my email addresses no longer exists. This is very alarming, but what is worse is that the trash folder for some email addresses no longer exists, which means as soon as I delete an email it is permenently gone. And some of my email addresses no longer have a 'sent' folder which means that after I have sent an email, there is no record of the email after it is sent. This is very concerning.

There is folder called 'junk' which should have 100s of emails in it, but it say there are only 17, When I select it, there are no emails there.

I would post a screenshot, but it would reveal all my email addresses.

The more I am looking into solving this the more I have discovered that thousands of my emails have disappeared. Especially those I have sent. I am devistated. These are my records.

How can I roll back to when thunderbird was reliable, and is there any way of salvaging this catastophe? And how can I trust thunderbird again, which was at one time most reliable?

I have tried the following advice I sought on bing:

To restore the Junk folder, you can go to Tools > Options > Security > Junk and check the box that says “Move new junk messages to”. Then, select “Other” and choose the Junk folder from the list. This will enable the Junk folder again and move any spam messages there. You can also right-click on any message and mark it as junk or not junk to train the filter. FAILED - IT HAS NOT RESTORED THE JUNK FOLDER

To restore the Sent folder, you can go to Tools > Account Settings > Copies & Folders and check the box that says “Place a copy in”. Then, select “Other” and choose the Sent folder from the list. This will enable the Sent folder again and save a copy of any messages you send there. You can also drag and drop any messages from your local folders to the Sent folder if you want to move them. LIMITED SUCCESS - 2 SENT FOLDERS HAVE BEEN RESTORED. Several have not been able to be restored using this method.

Another annoying change: It has put the 'File, Edit, View, Go, Message, etc' Tool bar under the 'Get Messages, Write, Reply etc" Tool bar. They should be the other way round.

I really hope all this can be solved.
creator: sheffield28

title: Thunderbird 115.2.2 will only allow me to send mail from one of my email accounts
content:
Thunderbird will now allow me to send emails from each of my email accounts. Each email has its own SMTP server login to send mail. If I setup the SMTP server for my main account, all other email accounts are automatically assigned the same SMTP Info as the main account. Of course they will not send, and server rejects the login using the info for the main account SMTP login. If I set up the SMTP Server info for one of the other accounts, Thunderbird automatically changes the SMTP Servier login information in the main account setting to match the SMTP login info of the secondary email account, and therefore, the main email account SMTP login is now rejected by the server since the SMTP server login info is not correct for the main email SMTP server login.

I need each email account to go back to using its own SMTP server login info so all of the email accounts can send mail.

By the way, receiving email is not an issue, since all accounts can and do contiue to receive email as they always have.

I can send from all of my email accounts on my Apple devices, iMac, MacBook Pro, iPad Pro, and iPhone 13 normally. This only occurs with Thunderbird.

I just upgraded to the latest Thunderbird, 115.2.2. That is not the issue, since the issue began with the previous Thunderbird version, 102.

How can I fix this?

Thank you.

Randy

creator: saw2k

title: Emails Opening Incorrectly in Thunderbird
content:
I routinely receive emails each day from "Nextdoor" community website. After opening the first of these in Thunderbird today, then closing it I went on to open more email which arrived before that Nextdoor email (I always open the latest email first). Although the other emails were from different sources and about different topics, each of them once more opened as the Nextdoor email which i had already viewed. It's such a strange thing which I have not previously encountered. After trying twice more with the same result I have variously closed and re-opened T'Bird, scanned the PC with FSecure anti virus, closed down and re-started the PC but with the same result. Subsequent new emails have opened normally but once again going back to the batch which arrived with Nextdoor, they are still opening as a Nextdoor email with the same topic as the first one I viewed.

I would be grateful for advice.

Geoff
creator: gramlagansingh

title: Sender rejected AUP#I-1320 o365 ->
content:
Sender rejected AUP#I-1320 o365 -> roadrunner Posted by ChipConnJohn on Nov 29th, 2017 at 11:06 PM 

Solved

Email wi.rr.com is randomly rejecting messages coming from a domain hosted on Office 365. The strange thing is the bounce message is not coming from rr.com. Office 365 is sending us a message saying wi.rr.com is rejecting the sender. I read through what MS says, which is basically, check your SPF record. The SPF record looks good to me. Anyone see why this is failing from the header?

dnvrco-cmimta11 rejected your message to the following email addresses: (PersonWithRRAddress@wi.rr.com) Your message was rejected by the recipient email server. Please check the recipient's email address and try resending your message, or contact the recipient directly. For more tips to help resolve this issue, see DSN code 5.1.0 in Exchange Online - Office 365. If the problem continues, contact your email admin. dnvrco-cmimta11 gave this error: <john@ourdomain.com> sender rejected AUP#I-1320

title: Using Fastmail - Sent Folder is called Sent on win but "sent items" on Mac
content:
I use Fastmail In Fastmail's web app, the sent mail accumulates in a folder called "Sent" On Windows TB is configured to save sent messages in Fastmail's Sent folder. On Mac, if TB is configured to save messages in "Sent" they go into a folder called "Sent" but that folder does not have the same contents as the "Sent" folder in Fastmail's web app.

In fact. on the Mac I must configure TB to save in a folder called "Sent Items". If I do that then the messages also appear in the Sent folder on tb-Windows and on the Fastmail web app.

I find this very confusing. Perhaps someone can explain the discrepency

Thank you
creator: essin
